description: A popular mini-macaw, mostly green with a distinctive bright yellow band on the back of its neck that develops with age. They have a black forehead and a reddish belly patch.
temperament: Intelligent, curious, and mischievous. They are known for being very playful and can be affectionate, but they also have a stubborn streak and can be nippy.
loudness: Loud for their size. They have a high-pitched, piercing call that can be quite repetitive when they want something.
vocalization: Very good talkers. They can develop a clear vocabulary of words and are known for their ability to learn tricks and mimic sounds.
dietaryNeeds: A balanced diet consisting of high-quality pellets, fresh vegetables, leafy greens, and a limited amount of fruit and nuts.
healthPointers: Can live for 50+ years. A hardy species. Prone to feather plucking if bored. They need plenty of chewable toys to keep their beaks in good condition.
housing: Needs a roomy cage, minimum 30"W x 24"D x 36"H. Their potential for noise makes them a challenging, but not impossible, choice for apartments.
